intro: Kosteletzkya grantii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a perennial vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, sunny environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can climb or trail along structures. Kosteletzkya grantii is also known for its rapid growth and ability to tolerate various soil types.
